event: Earliest human presence in present-day Mexico
Early agriculture develops with maize cultivation
Olmec civilization emerges as an early cultural center
Teotihuacan grows into one of the largest cities in the ancient world
Classic Maya cities flourish across southern Mexico
Toltec influence spreads from central Mexico
Aztecs found Tenochtitlán in the Valley of Mexico
Spanish expedition under Hernán Cortés arrives
Fall of Tenochtitlán marks the Spanish conquest
Viceroyalty of New Spain is established
Colonial society consolidates around cities, mines, and haciendas
Independence movement begins with popular uprisings
War with the United States results in major territorial loss
Republic is restored after foreign intervention ends
Mexican Revolution reshapes state and society
New constitution establishes modern political framework
